name: Park Hotel Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: It started off with checking in and getting upgraded. We stayed on the 5th floor in one of the suites. The room was beautiful, the bedroom was just amazing. The view from our room was overlooking the casino and the river. The washroom area where you shower and wash was breathe taking, but we did have a problem with the " Curtins" and that there were no doors for privacy. Also the Toilet was all out on its own on the other side of the room. We did order pizza as room service and it was good. not bad actually.
reviews.title: Good, But Strange?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over-all the Hotel itself is Beautiful and so are it's room. I just have a little problem with the washroom and toilet area. If i was travelling alone this would be my Ideal hotel, but I was with 5-6 of my friends from work and that just got a little awkward.
reviews.title: All style and no substance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Having been to the Park Hotel both before and after the refurb, I think that the hotel is very slick but that the owners have cut a few corners. We stayed in the new building, in a second-floor room facing Stadhouderskade.
reviews.title: OK hotel - but better ones avaliable in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're big on privacy, you won't like it here; the toilet was seperated from the rest of the room by a half-frosted glass wall, as was the shower. If we wanted more privacy our only recourse was a long shower curtain between the bed and toilet. Our shower leaked all over the floor whenever we used it.
reviews.title: great location and lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Recently refurbished this hotel is a very trendy hotel with a great decoration/interiour.
reviews.title: Make sure you stay in the new building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here after being double booked at the American Hotel and they booked us out to here. At first was very dubious on approach to hotel as there was building work going on but the welcome we received at reception was truly first class.
reviews.title: great staff, weird bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff here are really helpful and could not have done more for us.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Bedrooms are fine except for the very strange bathrooms. Strange in that the bathroom is actually in your bedroom and your modesty is protected by only frosted glass.
reviews.title: A great hotel - would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fine for my wife and I but if youwere travelling with someone you did not know intimately could be very embarrassing
reviews.title: THe people are so welcoming!
Comfortable accommodations, great location
reviews.text: We have just spent a weeknd at the Park Hotel - and could not fault it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back and glad to be in my own bed. although expensive this hotel was cheaper than many similar in the area. if staying don t pay the 23 euros for breakfast. lots of places to eat much cheaper nearby.
reviews.title: good location, expensive, cramped, beds too soft

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Park hotel. We last visited 2 years ago.
reviews.title: Second Stay - Not bad at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a great location in southern central Amsterdam. We caught a taxi from Centraal Station and it cost 13 euros. You could quite easily get a tram but with luggage we couldn't be bothered. The hotel is situated on a main road with a canal bang opposite. It's also within easy walking distance of Liedesplein and also has the Hard Rock Cafe and an Irish pub opposite. It's also in the museum quarter and the opposite end of town from the seedier Amsterdam districts.
reviews.title: modern,clean,great room,helpful staff and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: On arrival we couldn't believe the change. When we visited before the hotel was undergoing a big refurb and you could choose whether you stopped in the old part or the newly refurbished part. We had a superb modern room that was massive on that occasion!
reviews.title: Lovely Place, Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception area had been totally moved and looked amazing, the check in experience was spoiled slightly by some rude American bloke. We were stood about 6 feet away from the person in front of us (can't stand people who stand over my shoulder in queues!) when this guy just waltzed to the front and started lecturing the reception girl!! Not the hotels fault but it would have been nice if she'd have sent him to the back of the queue rather than serve him and apologise afterwards!
reviews.title: excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights with friends on a weekend trip to Amsterdam. The location is great - right by a canal where you can pick up boat tours, Van Gogh Museum, the Vondelpark, and about 5 minutes walk from the bars / restaurants around Leidseplein (much nicer than Dam Square / Central Station area). The Red Light District / Dam Square are about a 20 minute walk or a short tram journey, but to be honest it is great not to be right amongst the hordes of tourists (especially the stag/hen parties). There are lots of nice streets to explore on foot around the hotel with bars/cafes/restaurants where you can experience a slice of real Amsterdam life. The reception area and rooms have been recently refurbished and are modern and stylish. The breakfast room has not yet been done, and is a bit shabby compared the the other parts of the hotel, but I assume it is next on the list for the refurb! All in all a great base to explore Amsterdam from.
reviews.title: Perfect Amsterdam Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only booked this hotel because it said on the website that it had been re-modernised, we stayed here 2 years ago and the room was terrible so this time we were hoping for better.
reviews.title: Free upgrade... I think it was a downgrade!!!
A brilliant location
reviews.text: We booked a superior room which was advertised as all brand new with plasma tv open plan bathroom new beds etc but when we checked in the receptionist said she had upgraded us to an executive room which was good until we got to the room to find it was an old style room that had not been modernised, i rang recpetion to ask for our original room and was told that they had already filled it, what between us checking in and going up 3 floors to the room they had let it out i dont think so.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was still undergoing major works when we stayed we had not been informed of this and to get to our room we had to walk up a dust filled corridor with workmen everywhere.
reviews.title: Great location, however...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was dirty, the maid service was terrible one day we didnt leave the room till 11am an eventhough the maids were still doing our floor they did not attempt to clean our room, on the days they did clean all they did was make the bed and supply new towels, they never topped the coffee/tea up we had to ring reception for some more and it never turned up along with the non slip bath mat we rung them for twice which never turned up.
reviews.title: Classy and comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed this hotel. On arrival we were upgraded free of charge to a split level suite. The room was lovely for the price and I would definitely recommend to a friend. The location could not be beaten. I have stayed at other hotels in Amsterdam before but this is definitely my favourite and I will stay here again when I return. The attached restaurant was also one of the best in the area and I would also recommend. The only disappointing thing was the room service.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, even better location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I spent three nights at this hotel this month and it was overall a disappointing experience. While its location is convenient, there were just too many other inconveniences from the very beginning to warrant recommending it to anyone. First of all, as we always do when making hotel reservations, we had requested non-feather pillows before our arrival because I have asthma and am extremely allergic to down. There were feather pillows on our bed when we arrived, and when we requested different ones, not only did we wait a long time (and we were anxious to get out in the city) before anyone showed up at our door, the housekeeping person finally came and told us that he had been looking everywhere for non-down pillows and insisted that the ones he was holding were the only ones he could find. They turned out to be feather ones again. We wound up having to go downstairs ourselves to complain to the desk manager, who finally was able to find the appropriate pillows. The inconveniences continued....although there was a note saying that the bottles of water provided for us were free, there were no bottles of water provided other than the ones in the mini-bar. There was no ironing board, nor iron, and when we inquired because we had wanted to use one, we were told that they were all "out" and that if we wanted to iron anything we would have to go iron in a different room in the hotel. There were lights missing in the bathroom, and the only lights in the actual hotel room were one small and dimly-lit floor lamp, and dim colored lights (for which one could change the colors) behind the bed. There were reading lights coming out of the wall, but they were miniscule and malfunctioning. There were not enough towels and the shower flooded the bathroom because of the design of the shower door. In addition, the hallways of the hotel were poorly vacuumed, and when the housekeeping cart was in the hallway, it took up the entire space, making it almost impossible for even a normal-sized person to pass. All in all, considering the price of a room at this hotel, these inconveniences were unacceptable... there were lots of superficial minimalist design aspects to the hotel and room interiors, which they use to promote their hotel, however this is an example of form over function and comfort.
reviews.title: Disappointing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Myself, my Husband & our friends stayed for one night & it was brilliant. The staff were very helpful & courteous. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived but the Duty Manager sent us to the bar for complimentary drinks. The rooms were spacious & very well decorated. Breakfast was in the restaurant next door - Momo I think it was called, and it was without doubt the best breakfast we'd had in a european hotel. We are definately going back next year ! The location was perfect, and value for money without doubt. Right in the heart of the city & was a great base to get everywhere we wanted to go. I'd definately recomend to anyone.
reviews.title: Perfect Place, Perfect Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fab hotel -- We had taken this hotel from previous trip advisor's visits and was well worth it.
reviews.title: Has everything u could want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is so central and nothing is a problem. Check in was quick and no problem . we were asked if our first visit and were given maps local activities, discount vouchers along with the were and were not to go. The hotel is very up to date and like the sign says the living room and dining room are like home we even saw a visitor with their feet on the sofas.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel in an ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading mixed views of Park Hotel, we decided to book it straight away anyway as we hadn't much time left to do it. We went for a superior room and it was amazing. The view was very good, and our stay was just perfect. I can't really understand why breakfast is so expensive (€25), and even the rates in general are a bit pricey, but all was top quality - great comfy bed, excellent bathroom, very clean and very quiet, despite being localed on a very busy area (very central and walking distance from every site). There is a cruise canal, which I recommend highly at night, right opposite the hotel. The staff were very friendly and always very eager to help. I have nothing bad to report about the hotel, except perhaps the fact that it can be difficult to find one's way round, as there are lots of stairs and different levels that make it seem like a bit of a maze, but this is due to current renovation works. This didn't disturbed our stay in any way, because as I said before the room and the corridors were very quiet.
reviews.title: Very good choice

likes.liked: — The room - comfortable, modern and cosy.
likes.disliked: — The price of the extras (breakfast, room service, etc)

reviews.title: Loved the location
reviews.text: Amsterdam, The Netherlands: the Park Hotel: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Date: January 2008
reviews.title: I Frigin Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reveiwer: a Canadian from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada
reviews.title: Park Hotel Rebuild
Park Hotel was Brilliant
reviews.text: The location was perfect, within walking distance of museums and restaurants and other top sight seeing destinations within Amsterdam. It was also on a major tram route that was easy to use.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: Very satisfied with service, staff was very accommodating. Rooms were great, very comfortable beds, nice bathrooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel on the weekend of the 10th of May my partner & I. Firstly the location regarding public transport is excellent via train & tram, once I stepped inside it didn't disapoint nice appearance & decor, we arrived approx. about 10.30am so we though we would have to wait a while to get our room but alas no & another bonus was our room was upgraded from a superior to an executive room with an excellent view across the canal. The staff were excellent a provided us with maps etc., on searching for our room we did notice there is some building work going on it did not make our stay any better or worse. Facilities in the room were good, quality was also good. All in all I would have no hesitation to stay again & would recommend.
reviews.title: Class Hotel & Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: I have recently returned from a 2 day stay at the Park Hotel, Amsterdam. The hotel is situated near the museums of Rembrandt and Van Gogh. It is also adjacent to one of the many Canals, providing Lunch and Dinner Cruises which is very handy!
reviews.title: Good Position, but Undergoing Renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Hotel is a 5 minute walk from the main Rembrandt Museum and 10 minutes walk to the centre of the Amsterdam shopping district. It has many restaurants surrounding it, a sample of those are: Indian, Thai, Steak Houses, Chinese as well as fast food like MacDonalds and Hard Rock Café.
reviews.title: Great Location, Heavenly Beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The rooms are very compact and bijous – providing a double bed, toilet, shower, dressing table and Flat Screen TV. All you could need really for a short stay. The only down side to the Hotel when we visited, was that there was quite a bit of refurbishment going on. The hotel’s main Restaurant is closed and buffet breakfast is being held in one of the conference rooms. There is no on-site dining, other than snacks and room service. Apart from this, the hotel was just what we were looking for.
reviews.title: Great rooms & location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Park hotel in early Sept 09 and we both agreed it was a really nice and friendly hotel in a top location. The rooms and hallways are clean, the lobby and bar area looks very new and the staff were very welcoming.
reviews.title: mid-level hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our only complaint/dissappointment was the open plan bathroom in the room. the washbasin is near the side of the bed, albeit hidden by a kind of curtain. The shower and toilet cubicles do have doors but these do not lock, nor do they reach the top or bottom of the cubicle. I've been with my girlfriend now for a number of years but there are still some things you want to keep, ahem, private! Also the shower has two heads, one for a regular shower and one for a 'rainfall' shower. Our rainfall shower wasnt working, and the regular one came on with such power that it nearly flooded the bedroom.
reviews.title: Style over substance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: But anyway, that is really a minor complaint and didnt detract from our stay at the hotel. The main reason we chose the Park was its location - 2 minutes away from the Rijksmuseum and Leidseplein, 1 minute from the Vondelpark and little more than 10 minutes walk from the busy Dam Square which in turn is 5 minutes from the red light district and coffee shop area. Really you're right in the heart of everything but are removed enough to avoid the 24-hour tourist noise and bustle
reviews.title: Great Location, Excellent Front Desk, Great Breakfast Odd Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didnt eat at the hotel as breakfast was 25 euro a head so can't vouch for the food, but it LOOKED nice
reviews.title: Cannot beat the location, Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel website claims that the rooms are "Designed without interior walls, the open bathroom is truly unique and groundbreaking." In reality the "Superior" rooms are tiny, your bed is within reach of the toilet and the overspill from the shower partially floods the room.
reviews.title: 2nd stay - better experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: While the rooms are remodeled, and beautiful, the construction continues. Loud hammers and construction noise was heard throughout the day.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms
Clean Hotel Great Staff
reviews.text: Our check-in was very complicated and the front desk staff was, at times, very unfriendly. We actually had to call our credit card concierge for dining and shopping suggestions because the front desk staff seemed unapproachable, bothered, and short with their responses. An unwelcoming experience...but the rooms were nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Park Hotel was in a good location, convenient to all the activities. The room was very comfortable, modern and clean. The bar had a nice atmosphere and the drinks were very reasonably priced. All in all an excellent hotel!
reviews.title: Nice Stay... Tourist-Trap Pricing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great location and helpful staff that provided tram schedule and directions.
reviews.title: Comfy but Pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Wonderful location right by Museumplein and swanky retailers... Leidseplein is just a short walk away. You'll pay for the location, especially if it's summertime, but worth it.
reviews.title: Not what others say in the good reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at Park Hotel Amsterdam from July 13 till July 20 and then after 2-weeks cruise for one more night on August 1. I must say that it's the best hotel for this class I've ever stayed at. Even being Americans and getting used for everything big we were surprised by the size of the room. We had 4 huge pieces of luggage, 2 pretty big carry-on bags and still had enough room to move around. The room and the bathroom were very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The room had an electric tea-kettle and it was very convenient to have a cup of tea or coffee in the morning with a croissant from the local grocery store! The location is the best in the city: all major museums are just a few steps away (Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum), Rembrandt House and Anne Frank House are 20 -25 minutes of walking. The Canal Tour is right across the street. Leidseplein square is right behind the corner. It's an ideal location! The staff was extremely friendly: check in and check out were fast. Initially we had a room with a Canal view, but the noise from the street really bothered me during the night. After I mentioned it we were immediately given a new room facing the back yard (nice and quiet). And when we returned after our cruise to stay one more night - they already had a note and gave us a quiet room even without us mentioning it! Great service! If I had to go to Amsterdam again I would stay at Park Hotel without hesitation!
reviews.title: The best location, friendly staff, the best service!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at the Park Hotel with my wife and two friends in two executive rooms. We were very disappointed, the rooms are very small. The ensuite is two smoked glass cubicles in the bed room which give very little privacy as everything can been see and heard. They are very hygienic as when you have a shower it floods the toilet so you then need to mop it up with towel.
reviews.title: Small and over priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The access to these rooms is past the main lifts and reception desks and up the service elevator - nice. The view from the room of air vents and ducts on the roof is a delight if you are a heating and ventilation geek.
reviews.title: Good 4*, excellent location, small standard room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inter- connecting door in the room allowed us to listen to rythmic bed activities in the next room.
reviews.title: Its ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the hotal is approx £25 per person.
reviews.title: Excellent 4* Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were way too soft; no mattress, just a 4" thick piece of foam. The shower has half a glass door so the floor gets a big puddle when you shower. Lighting in bathroom is awful so it's a challenge for women who wear makeup. More design flaws abound but those are the worst. Way too expensive for what it is. Yes, a great location and a beautiful lobby but overall, not worth the price. Internet service is a rip off.
reviews.title: Gorgeous but with many flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my partner stayed at the Park Hotel for a 3 night break.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is stylish and moden although we found the staff to be quite rude. The best thing about this hotel though is its location. It's opposite the Hard Rock Cafe, an Aran Irish pub (lovely food) and a Wagamamas but only a 5 min tram away from Dam Square and the Red light District i.e. near enough to go see everything but good to have your hotel in a nicer area! The trams in Amsterdam are really easy to use and a great way of getting about.
reviews.title: Don't expect the best, nor the worst

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally on the hotel front, the reviews are correct when they say the rooms are compact (and yes the wet room shower does leak) but the rooms are still better than average for Amsterdam oh and the beds are amazingly comfy.
reviews.title: fantastic weekend away!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010
reviews.text: The only thing that annoyed me was that the hotel insisted upon taking a 150 euro deposit from my debit card on checking in but then were only able to refund it in cash on checking out instead of back to my card.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very nice, well kept and comfortable hotel. Spotlessly clean. Extremely helpful and cordial staff. Comfortable and CLEAN rooms. Great location for the occasional tourist! Great location for the occasional gambler (across the street from a casino). Downside.. everything is a la carte.. including wi fi and internet access..
reviews.title: Great value - great location - great comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed here once before, I had a certain expectation of quality.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: But we were disappointed by:
reviews.title: Great location nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - How small the room was (410 - don't do it)
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Centrally Located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - That the hotel bikes weren't on the house like other places we stayed but charged at €15 each a day when other local bike places charge €10 a day.
reviews.title: What a disappointment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: After having read through various reviews I decided that The Park Hotel looked a fairly decent option for the two nights that I was to be in Amsterdam. Having booked through Expedia, when a fourth member was to join our party I phoned them to upgrade one of the rooms from a single to a double. They told me there would be a charge of £111.00 to which I was shocked and phoned the Hotel directly who said that there would be no problem sorting out an upgrade once we arrive.
reviews.title: Not that impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the Hotel ( there are now 4 adults in our group ) I mentioned that I had spoken earlier to someone about the upgrade which they confirmed. Two of our party were going to share a room ( the double ) whilst myself and another colleague decided that we would spend a little extra and upgrade to a Superior room. This however seemed a little to much for the receptionist to cope with and after calling her manager for help they both struggled with the computer screen in front of them and finally turned round and said that we would all be upgraded to a double room! Not what we requested. ( and we were to be charged...no free upgrade here, not that we were looking for it ) Rather than confuse them any more I just agreed and said that I would pay the upgrade fee for all the rooms on departing. As most people feel after arriving by plane and then travelling by Taxi all you want to do is retire to the room, drop off the bags and venture out!
reviews.title: great value, great staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well the first night was hell, the double room that I had been given ( no. 153 ) was the noisiest Hotel room that I have ever stayed in. The heating pipes clattered and banged all night, there was one thick pipe that must have been supplying the whole hotel through my room, there was no heating control for the room and with the window open the noise was a little too much to sleep. In addition to this I think I was located next to the service elevator as ever few minutes there was a loud electrical hum that vibrated through the pillow.
reviews.title: Well Recommended - Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well after no sleep and seeing that the clock said 6:30am I decided to have another go at upgrading to a Superior room. Got dressed and ventured downstairs, this time there was a different face at the reception and this face was able to give me what I had originally asked for. zzz...
reviews.title: Classy, Clean, & Comfortable!

likes.liked: — It was very clean and modern!

reviews.title: One word sums up our stay at the Park Hotel - Excellent
reviews.text: Better room, newly decorated and had a minibar ( ah, cold water! ) after getting up and out for a lovely walk around the Leidseplein Square area I started to itch....yes I had been bitten three times on the left shoulder and upper arm by flees. I cant say whether it was room 153 where I had initially been put or the new one ( 440 ) but it did annoy me as for the rest of the day all I was doing was itching.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 3 nights in a superior room and it was lovely. Room was clean and modern. The open modern bathroom idea was ok, noone can see you in the shower or toilet as the doors are frosted black and a curtain can be pulled across. It has a flat screen TV and mood lighting, which was very funky. You also get plenty of cupboard space and the bed is very comfortable. Some floors in this hotel were still be renovated but this never interfered with our stay. Our room never had a hairdryer but if you asked at reception they provided you with one.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were first sent to a room that had people sleeping in it so we had to get another sorted, this was done straight away and later in our stay we got a letter apologising for this error which I thought was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Excellent Everything
good location
reviews.text: We never ate breakfast in there, as it was little pricey at 23.50 euros each for a continental breakfast. You only had to walk down the road to find somewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: We are glad we stayed in the museum quarter as some of the other areas where definitely not as nice. Hard rock café was just across the road from us, which was handy, and Vondel Park was adjacent to the hotel. We walked everywhere we went but beware of the trams and the bikes, they are everywhere. It took us only 20 minutes to walk to the Anne frank house. The Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum was just around the corner, about 5 minutes walking distance. Dam square took us bout 30 minutes and the Heinkinen Brewery was about a 15-minute walk.
reviews.title: great value

likes.disliked: — the front desk staff knowledge on restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We chose this hotel from a website agency, because we liked a review that we read about it, which called it their 'favourite hotel in Amsterdam'. Well, as it's the only hotel we have stayed at in Amsterdam, we cannot compare it, but can only say that we thanked our lucky stars that we chose to go there.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Park Hotel

likes.disliked: — Unfortunately as with all Amsterdam amenities, smoking is not banned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot fault this hotel. It was my second visit to the hotel and both times I was more than pleased. It is well located for the shops, bars and restraunts and also next to the best museums in Amsterdam. The staff were friendly ans welcoming. the room was one of the best 4 stars I have stayed in, unlike some hotels in Amsterdam that are not even 3 star quality, The absolute clincher for me was the breakfast though. The buffet style breakfast was vast and you could choose anything from a light breakfast to a plate full of what we English like.. bacon sausage, eggs. All in all a wonderful experience and I would return there without hesitation.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location but very limited parking and unless you can get something at the hotel it will cost you about £40 per day to park in the public one. (Attendants may be prepared to do a deal on cost!!!)
reviews.title: Quite good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel took shuttle to and from hotel and airport it was handled well on both ends. Executive room, double shower with large rain fall shower heads. Very nice! Excellent bed newly remodeled room with artwork, safe, mini bar. Room looked like pictures on Website. Had to walk up one flight of stairs but it was worth it pretty view even though not toward Leidseplein. Excellent location bought tram tickets and Van Gough tickets from desk clerk very convenient. Breakfast buffet was of good to great quality although expensive. Nice staff, who are very helpful. Would definitely return again.
reviews.title: Very nice stay at the Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the park hotel for my husbands 50th birthday, the pictures on the web looked great, the location was good, we stayed on the 6th floor in an executive room !! there was nothing executive about it, the king size bed was comfy, but the rest of the room ( it was very clean ) was in great need of an update, the bathroom (lovely thick white towels ) would have been excellent if the mildew had been cleaned from the tiles and a fresh shower curtain had been hung, we had a great weekend all the same,
reviews.title: good location, we stayed in an executive room on the 6th floor, ( great veiws )

likes.disliked: — dated furnishings, mould on the shower curtain/tiles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a couple of nights in mid August, arrived expecting a standard double room as booked on line and were provided without asking a free upgrade with a suite on the third floor overlooking the canal, Irish Bar and Hard Rock cafe - this was a recently refurbished room, it would be difficult to imagine a nicer room with a better view , absolutely outstanding.
reviews.title: Absolutely cracking hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb location - within walking distance of Vondel Park, the Museums, Leidseplein, and try the PC Hoofstraat about 100 away for the designer shops.
reviews.title: excellent room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The large room was superb - huge, comfortable queen bed with flat screen TV at your feet. Good mini bar, although I am always a little scared to sample the treats so could not comment on the cost. A superb bathroom of black ganite with fantastic shower, bath, excellent array of soaps, shampoo etc.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night. It was terrible, i never thought that 4star could provide such service.
reviews.title: Avoid it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was too small and tiny, it was very very cold. Only one good thing that we didnt spend much time in the room.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at The Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room price was 70 euro per night, but when we were leaving they blocked at my credit card 200 euro plus that sum i payed cash. The staff was unfriendly, so we never come back to this hotel. I think its star rating must be as a 2* hotel
reviews.title: Average and overpised.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a 'Run of the House' Double room via reserveahotelonline.com and managed to get a very good deal including breakfast.
reviews.title: City Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival, we were informed that they had a shortage of twin rooms (which we had been allocated) and were offered a newly refurbished Superior Room instead, which was very nice.
reviews.title: I give this hotel 9/10!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Park Hotel for 2 nights and loved it. We had the superior room. Great bed and very contemporary interior. Very friendly staff. The location is ideal and the restaurant is very good. It will be the hotel we’re staying at, next time in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: A perfect hotel, Ideal location and a great restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location! Walking distance from Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum and Von del park. Hotel is modern and it has nice lounge chairs. Our room was spacious, had a nice shower and a bath tub. The view of the hotel from outside is magnificent during the night. Canal cruises take off from right in front of the hotel, which is very convenient. My only compaint would be that I did not find the service that exciting; kind of luke warm welcome that I received.
reviews.title: Great location, great location, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel probably can't be bettered. The staff are OK, the food is OK, the facilities are OK. The rooms are clean, the bed is probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever occupied. HOWEVER, the room was tiny, irritatingly so. I would estimate the room to be about 2.5m x 5.5m and that includes the glass cubicles for the toilet and shower, which are actually in the bedroom, as is the washbasin. There was a gap of about 0.3m between the end of the bed and the wall and there is virtually no cupboard space.
reviews.title: Great location, bad rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think this hotel would be good for an overnight stay on business but not for a holiday with luggage.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel with a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a shame because when it was redesigned, it could easily have been so much better. I should think there is better for the price in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: A fantastic place to stay in this brilliant city

description: At the hub of Amsterdam's best city centre location, Park Hotel Amsterdam combines stylish looks and cosseting service with a contemporary mindset. A fabulous location, bang in the middle of one of Europe's most exciting cities between the famous Leidseplein, the Museumplein and the luxury fashion district.Park Hotel Amsterdam is a quietly sophisticated hotel offering understated elegance and unparalleled service. This luxury Amsterdam hotel, spread over several historical buildings, boasts 189 guest rooms including stunning suites, 9 flexible contemporary spaces for meetings, events, private dining and receptions, the Living Room, Park 24H Workout and MOMO Restaurant, Bar & Lounge.
